titleInfo.title: Photograph of Dora Corrine Adams Johnson, 1920s

location.physicalLocation: Special Collections Division of the Nashville Public Library, 615 Church Street, Nashville, Tennessee, 37219

mods.abstract: Original black and white photograph of Dora Corrine Adams Johnson seated outside in a chair. The back of the photograph includes biographical information including the name of her husband and his children and grandchildren. Dora Corinne Adams Johnson (1882-1952) was the daughter of Samuel Adams and Elmirah Adams. Samuel Adams was born into slavery in South Carolina and Elmirah is belived to be a Native American. Dora Corinne Adams Johnson was born in 1882, and was a member of St. James CME in Collierville, Tennessee, a church founded by her father. She later attended Mt. Pisgah CME in Orange Mound, Memphis, Tennessee. At both churches she acted as a stewardess, assisting in giving communion during church services. She died in 1952 and is buried at St. James CME Church Cemetery in Collierville, Tennessee.

titleInfo.title: Generations - African American Women's Early Activism in Tennessee
